paper.title: Concurrency and Automata on Infinite Sequences
paper.abstract: The paper is concerned with ways in which fair concurrency can be modeled using notations for omega-regular languages - languages containing infinite sequences, whose recognizers a.re modified forms of Buchi or Muller-McNaughton automata. There are characterization of these languages in terms of recursion equation sets which involve both minimal and maximal fix point operators. The class of ω-regular languages is closed under a fair concurrency operator. A general method for proving/deciding equivalences between such languages is obtained, derived from Milneru0027s notion of "simulation".
